Subjective: Redness in right eye since Tuesday, worsening; swelling compared to left eye; feeling of foreign object; pain when squeezing eyes shut; redness starting in left eye since yesterday. No vision problems, light sensitivity, or other illnesses. Request: Check if normal eye infection or something else; worried about worsening or contagion; wants to know if needs eye drops or antibiotics.
Objective: Both eyes: redness, no foreign objects, normal pupillary reaction. Right eye: more severe than left, swelling.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis. No signs of bacterial infection or other complications.
Plan: 1. Avoid rubbing eyes. 2. Use artificial tear drops for relief. 3. Clean with lukewarm water if eyes stuck shut. 4. Follow up if not improved after 2 weeks or if pain, pus, or increased discharge develops. 5. Not contagious after 24 hours of treatment.
